This game feels like a very poor imitation of the preceding two Bioshock games. It does not have the rich environments, the depth, the plasmid system is a poor and weaker imitation. Graphically the game is OK, perhaps it was better at the time of release but I am coming to this game in 2015 as it was in a Steam sale.

For me, a huge fan of Bioshock 1 and 2, this game is a big let down.

A brilliant, well crafted story coupled with great fps gameplay  comes together to form 2013's game of the year. (in my opinion and in mosts")

I'll skip over the gameplay problems, plenty of reviewers have covered them.

LOTS OF SPOILERS ALERT***

Booker  the protagonist is a completely unsympathetic character. I am  Metis. Playing a guy who commited genocide at Wounded Knee is like expecting a Jewish person to roleplay  as a repentent Nazi death camp operator or asking a African American player to play as a repentent plantation owner. Are you kidding me? The entire intertubes would be screaming in a game with such an opening premise yet this has been completely glossed over by every single critic. In this game it's a redeeming quality to want to be The Great White Proddy Saviour of the Irish Catholic, Black and Asian populaces while doing nothing of value to make amends to the actual minority people Booker committed the atrocities against? But then I guess all us  minorities are interchangeable, right?  Calling it a 'redemption story' in this context is meaningless at best, terminally egregious towards people of colour, at worst. I wanted to get past this, I truly did--but nothing in game happened to make me want to know Booker, never mind, wanna BE him enough to keep running around shooting complete strangers in the face for some illogical theological fairytale that this would redeem him for his past transgressions. So, for anyone out there that felt discomfited from the start of this game, there's psychological validity to that gut-clenching dissonance you experienced.

Booker has no agency as a character, at all. Everything is "yes", he cannot say "no" or else the game cannot progress. He is being led around by the nose in this game. While in Bioshock lack of real choice was cleverly built into the entire plot line--here it just served to pull me right out of the story. What good is his "repentence" if he actually has no choice as a character, to choose humanism or stay a self-centred bad azz? What if he actually wants to help Elizabeth live her own life? He can't. So much for player agency.  Somehow, the writers forgot that games are not films and without agency, such a protagonist is just not that interesting in the video game medium. How is shooting the sheeyit out of everyone in sight cohesive with any of that world-building?

I leave it to more experienced game critics to answer the questions on why this is destroyed by being an FPS in the first place.

All I could think of as Booker fifteen minutes into it was, "Why the he11 am I mass murdering all these people? What has changed since Wounded Knee?  I am slaughtering townspeople of all colours by the thousands for what? ONE GIRL and some unnamed debt?" There's nothing likeable about the guy, which might be entertaining if he was a complex 'magnificient baztard' trope but he's not amusing enough to qualify for that. Every time he used missed tenses or slang, it was cringeworthy. He spoke clean English except the oddly jarring occassions where he suddenly developed amnesia about past/present tenses that he knew five minutes ago. He's educated enough to fill out reports as a top Pinkerton's man yet he can't manage to string together a proper sentence?

Elizabeth is every street john's wet dream. You rescue this sheltered teenaged damsel in distress then she spends the rest of the game gratefully throwing you useful articles and money while dodging bullet spray. Duh, Whut? You can't actually have a conversation with her. She's like a rubber blow-up doll with pre-programmed responses as robotic as Booker's. Her reaction to all this mass slaughter after a quiet life is to run away from you [smart girl]then stops [eejit alert, you're a mass-murdering psycho with a chainsaw in your hand and btw where are you getting batteries for that thing?] Never once does she have a gigantic melt-down even when she commits her first murder. She devotes an entire thirty seconds decrying her decisions that caused the devestation of an entire city full of human beings. Yet she does a 180 shift from that personality to forgiving her cruel adoptive mother's ghost for hating her in a scene so saccarine my controller got diabetes. The game writers don't seem to know the difference between momentary sentimental dosh and a gamer being deeply moved by psychological depth displayed by in-game characters. The psychologically unsound character inconsistancies threw me completely out of the game. At that point, I stopped caring a whit what these two mass murdering fiends did and just wanted to finish the game off as quickly as possible. So much for "deep emotional content". 

Every single character in this game is a cliche. There's no complexity or cohesion to their actions or beliefs.

I kept on playing hoping the character's actions would display some pragmatic justification. Dimension-hopping as an excuse for taking no responsibility for mass slaughter just doesn't cut it. I kept hoping the story would converge in a way that would make sense.

It didn't.

A good storyline in a game can leave a player elated, grieving, ecstatic, panicked or with various complex emotions that can take time to sort through. A satisfying story can cause a player to ponder for days and ask questions about the depth of the experience and the meaning behind their personal responses to that game. This one can't. It's all washed away in a tide of convoluted, Whovian time-jumping paradoxes and Farscapian alternative dimensional mind-boggery--without any of the fun.

This game is video cotton candy. It is pretty to look at, gives the illusion of being more substantial than it is. Like cotton candy it only consists of surface fluff and consuming too much of it will make you throw up.

If you're looking for a cohesive plot or character/sociopolitcal depth in this game people, move along. It's a shoot-em-up with pretensions of quantum mechanics grandeur.

I went into this game thinking it would be the best game ever, I was disappointed...

Positives
-Great FPS gameplay and mechanics 
-The Graphics are great without being difficult to run
-The City of Columbia is beautiful and breathtaking
-The ending is one of the best i've ever seen

Negatives
-You only end up using one gun (Volley Gun) and one Vigor (Shock Jockey) making the gameplay repetative
-There is no variation in gameplay, walk into a room, shoot some guys, talk, walk to another room, and shoot more people, rinse and repeat.
-The game explores themes like Racism, then ~3 hours in forgets about it
-The city of Columbia is there for ~1 hour
-Skylines are really fun, until they just become a bland and forgettable 
-I went into this game being told that Elizabeth was amazing, and whilst her story arc is incredible I have a few gripes. She disappears during fights only to teleport to you, hand you whatever you need, then disappear. She walks around then stops to observe things [strike] In a human and lifelike way [/strike] in painfully obvious scripted events only to give exposition or on about 2 occasions to get reviewers to praise her "Human attributes"
-Choices make no difference at all
-Ending has a few plot holes 

Now you may look at the amount of positives and negatives and be confused, this is a good game but has been overrated way too much, the game has been a real experience but never forget the never ending hoarde of enemys *Shudders*

С головой погрузился в это произведение искусство и прошел за два насыщенных дня. Восхитительная история, прекрасно сплетенные между собой два сюжета, которые полностью перекрывают мелкие огрехи и простоту геймплея. Потрясающий визуальный стиль, а также очаровательное музыкальное оформление жестокой Колумбии - пожалуй, лучшее приключение, которое я испытывал в видеоиграх.

При этом геймплей очень неплох. Динамичный трехмерный (в смысле пространства) шутер с довольно неглупым ИИ - то, что останется с Bioshock Infinite, если убрать из проекта Кена Левина.

Скажу честно упор сделан на сюжет на то что с вами будут бегать союзники и вы станете свидетелями гражданской войны и падения "великой державы". Но где мы всё это видели? в half-life 2, разработчики взяли самый успешный шутер своего времени...да и не только своего и выжали из него всё лучшее. Конечно у них это получилось игра стоит своих денег и пары вечеров свободного времени, просто мне не удалось пережить чего-то нового и это слегка разочировывает.

great game, got it on sale for 8 dollars so my complaints wont be so harsh... but heres my opinion. its not worth full price, not one bit... its literally 7 hours long, and i took my damn sweet time. story was great and so were the characters, and near the end there was one of the biggest mind fucks of all time... making you feel disgusted cause you were attracted to to your own daughter. lots of cool weapons, but you'll most likely just be using carbine and machine gun the whole game as they're the best ones. you can upgrade your weapons too, but the system for it is shit compared to bioshock 1, and since you'll be only using those two weapons... you'll totally forget about the upgrade shop in general after you upgrade only 8 times. aiming down sight is obsulete, as hip fire is more acurate for headshotting. the new plasmi- err "vigors" are nice... but not as cool as the plasmids from the original series, and you'll find most of them you wont even use. those are some of the things in this game i could think of that make it a less solid game, but i never said it was not a good game... its a great game, and i highly recommend it. but not at full price. one more thing, it does not have much content once you beat the story, unless you want to achievement hunt... or buy the DLC.
Good graphics, awesome storyline and a helpful sidekick, would definitely recommend it

10/10

Als Fan von guter Story muss ich sagen: Bioshock Infinite ist das beste Spiel das is je gespielt habe.

Die Geschichte ist unglaublich fesselnd, was sie bis zu Burial at Sea 2 durchzieht. Nach dem beenden der erweiterung bemerkt man dann sogar, dass die gesamte Story von Infinite mit Bioshock 1 & 2 verbunden ist, wonach man erst einmal komplett geflasht und verwirrt vor seinem Bildschirm sitzt :)

Auch das Kamfsystem ist gut ausgeklügelt, das Spiel umfangreich gestaltet und die Grafik immernoch bombastisch.

Ich emfehle wirklich jedem dieses Spiel zu spielen, ihr werdet dann verstehen warum ich und viele andere es so lieben.

[h1]It's not that good. It's average[/h1]

First of all, I'am not through the whole game, maybe in the middle, and if I change my mind I'll tell you. And I don't want to make the game mad, this is just my opinion about it. 

[b]SHORT:[/b] It could have been a really cool adventure game if there would be more interaction with the people and the city, or it could have been a cool shooter if there would be more enemies instead of the townfolks.

[b]LONG: (bonus: more bad english)[/b] 
+ Really nice visual style
+ A good story with interesting characters
+ All the shooter relevant stuff (controls, response, etc)

- You never get the feeling that this city is alive. It's huge, it's flying, has lots of intersting places and is filled with 3 or 4 people. To be honest, there are some more, but it all feels pretty empty after the introduction levels. You can't really interact with the townfolks unless they are relevant for the current event and a lot of them look alike.

- Enemies mostly come in short waves after triggering a certain point or do something offensive (what the game counts as offensive is sometimes a bit weird). The townfolk is simply vanished, no one is running around, hiding in fear (at least I never saw that)

- Until now there is no good use for vending machines because most of the times you can't efford the stuff you really want. You run through the levels search in every corner to find a few bucks just to find out that you can efford:
[list]
    [*] Ammo - which you don't need because there arent that much enemies..and the few drop ammo.
    [*] Medkits - which you don't need because there was a lot of healthy stuff in that corners you've searched before.
    [*] NO UPGRADES - they are there, you just can't efford them, go...search more bucks in more corners.
[/list]

- There are more things that all together often break the immersion and the flow of the game which is kind of sad because the scenario is more than awesome. It's still not a bad game but it's neither a good shooter nor a good adventure. It is somewhere between the two missing the better parts.
